concept.title: What is Valid GDSL Code
concept.shortdesc: How to write valid GDSL code

conbody.p: While GDSL is a simple scripting language, it gives users a lot of flexibility with authored image and data files. There are rules to writing valid GDSL code, however:

ul.li: If and Else are the only branching/conditional statements.
There is no iteration or recursion as there are no 'for' or 'while' loops.
All variables are global in scope.
Braces must be used for any statements/expressions longer than one line.

conbody.p: Once you have entered GDSL code into the Editor, you click Validate to make sure it is well-formed and valid. If it is valid then the button's color will change to green and if not, the button's color will be red.
